intro: Pentacalia carmelitana, commonly known as the Carmelita bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces showy blooms during the spring and summer months. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
